title: Noam Chomsky interview, Tucson, 28 October 2019
description:
Interview with Noam Chomsky on the targets, prospects and tactics of political action today.
Conducted by Thomas Pogge; recorded and processed by Michal Apollo.

This Interview was part of the 2019 annual Yale Global Justice Program conference organized jointly with Academics Stand Against Poverty (ASAP) and the Albert Schweitzer Institute of Quinnipiac University: Anat Biletzki, Daniele Botti and Sujata Gadkar-Wilcox.

The thumbnail shows Noam Chomsky, his wife Valeria Chomsky and Michal Apollo in Chomsky's office in the Linguistics Department of the University of Arizona in Tucson.
